title: October 15–22: Final Push
description: Simulate final campaign momentum by practicing live media appearances, refining messaging under time pressure, and making strategic media decisions.

tasks.prompt: Podcast Appearance: Prepare an introduction and brief campaign statement. Explain your priorities and why voters should support you. Responses will be evaluated for clarity, empathy, and persuasiveness.
Media Engagement: Decide how to allocate CC for ad buys, social media campaigns, or press releases. Explain your choices and strategy.
Final Narrative: Draft a short closing pitch summarizing why voters should support you. Ensure clarity, conviction, and alignment with campaign messaging.

narrator: This is your last chance to sway undecided voters. Participate in podcasts, media campaigns, and strategic messaging exercises.
readingSummary: October 15–22 emphasizes live media engagement, final messaging, and strategic allocation of campaign resources.
Strong communication and clarity can significantly impact voter approval and Candidate Coins (CC).

tasksDetails.prompt: Prepare your introduction and brief statement for a podcast. Focus on priorities and voter persuasion.
Make media spending decisions and explain your rationale. Options include ad buys, social media campaigns, or press releases.
Draft a concise closing pitch. Strong responses improve signatures and approval; weak responses reduce momentum.

sources: General Election October 15–22 A – Simulator Test Mode

outcome.description: Updated CC and voter approval based on media, podcast, and final narrative performance. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively under time pressure. Improved campaign momentum and credibility for the final week.
